[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [LogEntry: InvariantViolated] [Critical error hiding] If InvariantViolated events are logged but not acted upon, can this hide consensus safety violations until it's too late? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [LogEntry: MempoolFullEvictedTxn] [Transaction loss] Can evicted transactions be lost without trace if logging fails, allowing validators to silently drop valid transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [LogEntry: TransactionFilter] [Censorship detection] Does TransactionFilter logging reveal which transactions were rejected and why, or can validators hide censorship by not logging rejected txns? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [LogEntry: DBError] [Storage failure] Can repeated DBError logs indicate imminent storage failure, but are they exposed to monitoring tools before catastrophic data loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Edge: Default trait] [Zero-initialized] TxnsLog implements Default - does default initialization create the same inconsistent state as new(), or is it safer? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Edge: Partial equality] [Comparison] If two TxnsLog instances need to be compared (e.g., for testing), does the lack of PartialEq implementation hide discrepancies? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Edge: Clone] [Deep vs shallow] If TxnsLog needs to be cloned, is there a clone implementation, and does it properly deep clone all owned data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Type: Option wrapping] [None handling] All LogSchema fields are Option - if code unwraps without checking, can this cause panics in logging paths crashing validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Type: Tuple complexity] [Memory layout] The txns vector stores 4-tuples - does this create padding or alignment issues causing wasted memory or cache misses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Type: NetworkId] [Network confusion] Can logging wrong NetworkId values cause transactions to appear on wrong networks (mainnet vs testnet) in logs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Macro: Schema derive] [Code injection] Does the Schema derive macro from aptos_logger properly sanitize field names, or can malicious field names inject code during macro expansion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Macro: Serde derive] [Serialization bug] Can the Serde derive macro generate incorrect serialization code for LogEntry or LogEvent causing log corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Performance: Synchronous logging] [Blocking] If logging is synchronous and blocks transaction processing, can an attacker cause slow disk writes to degrade validator performance below consensus thresholds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Performance: String formatting] [Allocation hotspot] Does Display trait formatting allocate many temporary strings, causing GC pressure and making validators susceptible to timing attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Performance: Iteration] [O(n) display] Formatting TxnsLog is O(n) in txns.len() - can this create quadratic behavior if logs are formatted repeatedly during debugging? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Consistency: len vs txns] [Invariant] The invariant 'len >= txns.len()' is implicit - can this be violated through unsafe code or if the struct is manually constructed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Consistency: max_displayed] [Limit enforcement] Is max_displayed checked in all add*() methods consistently, or can some code paths bypass the limit? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Consistency: Option fields] [Field presence] LogSchema has 13 optional fields - is there validation that related fields are set together (e.g., if peer is set, is_upstream_peer should be set)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Crypto: Address format] [Hash truncation] If AccountAddress is a hash that gets displayed in truncated form, can this enable second-preimage attacks where two addresses collide in logs? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Crypto: Nonce security] [Nonce reuse] Can logged nonce values be replayed if an attacker gains access to logs and the nonce generation is weak? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Testing: Edge cases] [Test coverage] Are there tests for len overflow, max_displayed=0, extremely long status strings, and concurrent access? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Testing: Fuzzing] [Fuzzer coverage] Has this file been fuzzed with random inputs to add_with_status() to detect format string issues or panics? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/mempool/src/logging.rs] [Testing: Property testing] [Invariants] Are invariants like 'len >= txns.len()' checked via property-based testing across all operations? (Low)
